column5: The kids are going to LOVE santa this year LOL!  My oldest has been asking for a Dog for 3 years, and the time was right. "Spud" was an 11 month to 18 month old stray picked up by the humane society, who is fixed, and up to date on all his shots, with a clean bill of health and well socialized with Children, other dogs, and Cats, and is well trained. Answers to sit, lay down, stay, heal, and wait. He shakes a paw, and is incredibly obedient! Great family pet in the making!  And the Hunter in me "might" be just a tad excited that he's a well trained BEAGLE  It really feels like Christmas this year, knowing the Kids are going to be over the moon excited, plus... I have a new buddy to enjoy the outdoors with this year. Its even more sweet knowing there is one less stray that will be spending Christmas in a pen. No better way to get into the Spirit of Christmas, then giving a new home to needy Stray  Introducing Spuddy   Cheers
Spuddy looks like the perfect pet for your family Cookslav     Good on you for rescuing an animal in need  I'm sure the kids including you will be spending some great time together Leechman
Good on you, you will have a friend for life for all the right reasons.  Art

excellent !!!!!! you made christmas for both your familly AND Spud, so much special.Strays are so much more appreciative.All my mutts are strays, and i have never gone wrong Merry Christmass to all of you
Awesome! Spuddy..Lovet it, and the dog! Merry Christmas to you and your newly extended family!!
Between you and Solo,yer killing me.  Another friend to share with the family and yer outings.  Merry christams to your family and Spuddy.  Good on ya.

Congratulations on your newest addition Spuddy!!! He looks absolutely adorable.  You're kids will be super happy, Spuddy gets a new home and you have a new hunting partner/best friend, doesn't get any better then that at Christmas time

I really don't know who will be more excited Christmas morning the kids or me LOL...   There are a lot more good pets out there in need of good homes bud. No shortage of Strays unfortunately....  Cheers
Awesome, great looking dog who I'm sure will be well looked after in your home.  Congratulations.
